result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ladarius Antonio Staten

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ladarius Antonio Staten appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Ladarius Antonio Staten.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Gonzalez.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ladarius Antonio Staten not in court, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court in person for Ladarius Antonio Staten.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel requests an adjournment due to caseload. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ladarius Antonio Staten not in court, defendant in custody. Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-Lee hearing or Status, Court denied request.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with B O H; J A H; D A T
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Ladarius Antonio Staten in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Ladarius Antonio Staten in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ladarius Antonio Staten appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
